edu.nd.darts.cimon
Class AdminObserver

java.lang.Object
  edu.nd.darts.cimon.AdminObserver
All Implemented Interfaces:
AdminObservable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SensorObserver, SystemObserver, UserObserver
public abstract class AdminObserver
extends Object
implements AdminObservable

A custom observer class used to provide updates to CIMON administration app. This is a custom observer, which doesn't require IPC, since the administration app and the metric services are always in the same process. This is a more lightweight method of providing updates to the administration app, so that repeated queries of the database is not needed to fetch the rapidly changing metric values. These values are updated directly by the metric services.

Author:
chris miller
See Also:
CimonListView, NDroidAdmin

setActive

public boolean setActive(int metricId,
                         int monitorId)
Set status of metric monitor to active. Used by administration app to indicate that a monitor is active through the administration app.

Parameters:
metricId - id of individual metric being monitored
monitorId - monitor id of active monitor
Returns:
true if succeeded, false if status was already active

setInactive

public boolean setInactive(int metricId,
                           long monitorId)
Set status of metric monitor to inactive. Used by administration app to indicate that an active monitor through the administration app has been stopped.

Parameters:
metricId - id of individual metric being monitored
monitorId - monitor id of previously active monitor
Returns:
true if succeeded, false if status was already inactive or monitorId didn't match

registerObserver

public void registerObserver(AdminUpdate adminUpdate,
                             Handler handler,
                             long minInterval)
Description copied from interface: AdminObservable
Register an observer to receive updates from observables. The observer will be a listview within the administration app.

Specified by:
registerObserver in interface AdminObservable
Parameters:
adminUpdate - observer registering to receive updates
handler - updates will be posted to this handler, should be handler for listview UI thread
minInterval - minimum interval to throttle updates, in milliseconds

unregisterObserver

public void unregisterObserver(AdminUpdate adminUpdate)
Description copied from interface: AdminObservable
Unregister observer to stop receiving updates. This should be called in onPause of observer, to avoid performing updates on listview which is not visible.

Specified by:
unregisterObserver in interface AdminObservable
Parameters:
adminUpdate - observer to unregister from observable

                               int groupId)

Register an observable to be notified when a new observer is present.

Specified by:

Parameters:
observUpdate - observable that will be providing updates
groupId - id for metric group (category) as specified in Metrics

Parameters:
